comment: Professor Bariteau is the best online professor I have ever had. She is very timely with grading and provides great feedback when needed. Assignments are clearly stated and simple to follow. Weekly quizzes are based on the textbook material which is free. No final exam or project.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: I took Intro to Weather and Climate in a 2 week course over the summer. Although the info was difficult, she graded very very generously. I failed alot of the textbook practice assignments but it didnt count as much. So I still finished with an A because of labs and questions. Great Professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I took her The Digital Earth class for my last science class, and she's great and organized, but I will say that she makes you go on a different website to create maps, and her directions can be confusing, so it'll take an hour or 2 to complete. But overall, she's great! Easy A!

Overall, I would say that the course load was very manageable. Prof Bariteau provides good, clear feedback and is quick to respond. However, because the textbook is really the only source of learning material, I found it difficult to stay focused quite like I would in a lecture-based class. But if you don't mind reading, then I would def recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: I have taken professor Bariteau for two courses. Last semester I took the weather course with her (I don't remember the exact course name) but I did not enjoy that class at all. All assignments were so long and tedious. This semester I took her for GEOG 1110 - The digital earth, and this course was a lot better as the workload was not as heavy.
Awesome professor! The work isn't "easy" but if you actually put the time in it, it becomes so much easier throughout the semester. Take her, I loved the class, personally.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: I did enjoy this professor, her assignments were interesting and taught me a lot; however, some of the lab instructions were a little confusing. She emails back quickly if you have any questions, and she does want you to do well. She is a bit harsh of a grader, but if you can take her for this class I would!
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Professor was very easy. She has clear grading rules and expectations. The most important thing is to do the assignments. I took it in a 4-week class during the summer, while working and taking multiple other classes and was able to get an A easily.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I took the May semester of GEOG 1102 which is 12-days long. The amount of work is a lot as to be expected. She says it'll take 2-4 hours a day to complete the assignments but for me, it took 6-8 hours every day. Ebooks Labs and discussion posts take up most of the time. It's very accelerated and you need to manage time wisely.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This class is work-heavy, but it is very manageable. She spaces work out so that each unit takes 2 weeks, and some assignments are due week one, and some are due week two. As someone who can get overwhelmed pretty easy, this was SUPER helpful. Some units were harder than others, but she gives good feedback if you mess up. No tests in this course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Bartieau is extremely helpful. The class consists of: One review assignment, one practice assignment, a discussion post, a lab, and then a quiz every 2 weeks. If you keep up, turn in your work on time, PAY ATTENTION TO DEADLINES, and read her feedback, you will do great. The class is online, and very simple. Lastly, it is so entertaining!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Easy class, bad professor. Although her labs are tedious, they aren't hard, but she grades kinda harsh. I had to rush my sibling to the hospital and missed the final exam, and she wouldn't let me take it despite explaining my situation and providing proof. I would've gotten an A+. She had an attitude all semester long, and no one liked her.

While this class isn't hard, it's definitely time-consuming since there are no tests and instead a lab every week, with a huge final project at the end. Prof B is pretty lenient on grading though as long as you completed the lab and put in effort. MCHill is used for SB and quizzes are on D2L. Overall pretty good class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Beware of deadlines, one week may have nothing due, the next three projects in a day. Easy class if you time manage well. One semester long final project that's very easy. Weekly quizzes/smart books/discussions all easy. There are 8 labs some are more time consuming than others. All in all an easy class once you get in a rhythm.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: I was worried about taking Science online, but she made it very easy! Just follow the instructions and you will get an A on the assignments. Discussion posts and quizzes were very easy. One semester-long project that you can get done in two days and get a 100. Some people struggled on labs but I thought they were easy and only take about an hour.

Good professor but the videos for labs on the websites were not updated. With this being so it took a while to understand the labs. Overall I learned a lot in this class but just be careful to not let the assignments sneak up on you because of it being online.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: This professor is very good at telling students what she wants done and how to do it. She gives very clear and detailed instructions. She is also very good at responding to emails quickly. It was not hard to do well in this class if you are okay with going quite a bit of busy work. There is for but its rather easy, just give your self time.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: I took this class online and it was honestly easy! The Professor is super sweet and gives such clear instructions. The modules can be confusing, so keep up with the schedule. There are quizzes (without a camera) which are easy! Textbook questions are also super easy. Labs are easy but take some time. And a final project at the end.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I took this class online & it has gone pretty well. Each module is 2 weeks: week 1 has a discussion post & a lab, & week 2 has a textbook ch. assignment & a quiz. We're at the end of the semester currently & the timeframe of assignments has gotten closer. There's also a final project. The only struggle I've had is the lab instructions can be vague.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Bariteau is extremely caring and wants her students to succeed. Weather and climate is a pretty easy and straight forward class but she is there to answer any questions. You're graded on weekly readings, discussion, quizzes, labs, and a final project. I was able to get an A and only did half of the final project. Easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Good amount of work for an elective course, but work is not hard. Take her easy A or B

Awesome instructor! Very kind and responsive over email, she cares about the students' learning and is also very aware of students being people outside of her class. She accepts late work - with a penalty - and she is not beyond extending a due date entirely if she thinks a student needs it.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: She is so sweet! She really cares about what she is teaching and the labs are really not too hard. She really wants you to learn. Love her! Take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Great class and lovely professor! The quizzes are timed, but she gives 2-3 attempts on them. Labs will look difficult and complicated, but they aren't, and she grades very leniently and gives excellent feedback. No tests, but one big final project. She has a real passion for this class and it shows!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH- TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!! Professor Erinn is a beautifully kind woman who does her best to help her students succeed. She has clear instructions, grading rubrics, and is incredibly available to answer questions or give suggestions/hints. She answers all emails kindly and promptly. 8 (easy graded) labs, and 7 easy quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is composed of 8 labs, 7 quizzes, 7 discussions, and one huge final project. I honestly would not recommend buying the book since I only used it once or twice this whole semester. The quizzes are all very easy As, this is an easy class if you do your part!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Idk why she has a bad review, but Professor Erin was great! For an online lab class it was easy. I will say I did mention to her that she needs to go back and update some of her instructions on her labs, however they're not difficult. Some are little time consume, but some are short and quick. Plus she gives you more than enough time to complete it
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Sometimes instructions were not clear but the professor was always accessible outside of class to help us figure everything out.

Make sure you actually do your best work. She is very nice and actually makes you interested. However, you do need to work for your grade and turn in quality work. She is very understanding and gives you plenty of time to complete the work. She is a great choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: What a fun class! Even online, Mrs. B made everything about the class so exciting and it was super easy to keep up. Gives you more than enough time to complete each chapter's work and grades really fairly with excellent feedback. Definitely recommend this class if you're looking for something you want to enjoy!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I loved this class! It consisted of labs, quizzes, a final project, and some extra credit. Some of the labs are difficult and take a while, but she is super easy to reach you and very willing to help. She's also willing to work with you if you mess up an assignment or something, wants you to succeed.I would absolutely recommend Professor Bariteau.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Erinn Bariteau always gave very clean instructions on what she wanted done. Two weeks worth of work only took about three hours to complete. If the work was spread out through the weeks it was easy. There are bonus assignments and every quiz has about 2-3 attempts. Every quiz was open book and it shows you what you got wrong.

comment: She is so nice and is always quick to respond to emails. The quizzes are all super easy and the labs are pretty easy but just very time consuming. I would definitely take her!

comment: One of the best professors I've taken at KSU. I was nervous to take a GEOG class especially online but Professor B made it so easy, you get two weeks to complete one module and you get multiple attempts on quizzes. She is so sweet, please if you're gonna take GEOG take her course you will not regret it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Ms. B is an amazing and caring teacher. I was first hesitant about this 4 credit hour course but Ms. B made it an enjoyable experience. There are roughly 10 labs and quizzes throughout the semester. As long as you stay organized and on track with the material you will earn an A. There is no final exam but a final project. Youll do great with Ms. B

comment: Prof. Bariteau is the best science professor I've ever had. I don't like science, but she made this class easy and enjoyable. Workload is very doable. Instructions are super clear and she gives examples on everything. Super accessible for questions and helps everyone out. TAKE HER! She's the best.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Caring

comment: Her lectures are great and helpful. She posts the presentations online, so you can be prepared before class. Be sure to get the labs done. My class ended up with more assignments to do like discussions and other stuff because classes ended up being online only (COVID-19).
rating_tags: Gives good feedback

comment: Ms. B was an awesome professor. She is funny and she is so passionate about the content she teaches. I would highly recommend taking her. She is always available to help outside of class too, which is nice. Her class was not too hard if you showed up to class and paid attention. Textbook is not required.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: go to class, she has the random attendance check for a grade. easy grader on labs. tests are easy too.

comment: Super easy professor. Follow the directions, do your best, and you're bound to get an A. The quizzes are a little tough, but just read the book and pay attention to highlights. NO midterm or final, just an easy final project! Mrs. B is very communicative and answers any questions in a timely fashion; she's very supportive. Take her if you can!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Only 8 labs. Sign up for weather challenge its very easy & U get extra credit for it & U only submit the forecast twice a week, she will teach U how to do it. 2 test only & a final, study hard for the test. go over the study guides she gives & look @ quizlet. She has random Investigations that she grades for atendance (counted for completion)
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I really liked her. Her labs I found difficult sometimes because It was my first time actually doing labs for a class. But you take about 2 hours for these labs. rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Lots of homework

comment: She is the most amazing professor Ive ever taken! I took her for GEOG 1112 online and she is so organized with each unit folder. As long as you put in the work and understand the concepts, youll pass her class. If you are struggling with something in the course(never happened to me)then you can meet with her in person on campus. Love her so much!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Straight to the point easy class. Discussion post, lab and quiz each unit. I kept a 99% the entire semester. Do the work and you will pass no problem. Only thing I didn't like was that the final project was required no matter what grade you had. If I didn't do it I'd go from a 99% to and 85% but I only needed a 39% on the project to still get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Ms. Bariteau is an amazing teacher. I am a senior at KSU, and I waited until the last minute to take my gen ed science course. I am glad I took it with her. She responds to emails quickly, and she is willing to answer any questions you may have. You have labs that are easy, and 3 exams. The exams are not difficult if pay attention in class.
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Caring

comment: This class was beyond amazing. Mrs. B is always excited for class,, her passion is obvious and shows how great of a teacher she is. We had 8 labs that were very easy,, she gives a guideline for each and you literally only have to fill in the blanks. No homework and 3 tests were all multiple choice and study guide helps a lot. Would 100% recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: She is really passionate about what she teaches and makes sure that students are understanding the content. There are 4 attendance activities that she randomly puts out through out the semester which will count for a grade so go to class. Don't buy the textbook because you won't need it. As long as you go to class you will be fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Bariteau is passionate about Weather/Climate and it shows. Her lectures are solid, she teaches in ways for student to understand. She does do random checks for attendance which counts as a grade, so I recommend attending her classes. Do not buy the book as you will not need it, just take notes or look at her powerpoints on D2L.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's a lovely teacher. She enjoys the criteria and presents it in ways that make the subject fun and understandable. Powerpoints are easy to access and read. There are quizzes and tests based on the book and some powerpoints. The assignments she provides are fun and she always wants your feedback to help her better understand the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Super easy class. She takes attendance 4 times but on random days. Labs and tests are relatively easy if you show up to class. Never really read the textbook but some people found it helpful.

Professor Bariteau is amazing! There is 1 lab due each week and some can be challenging but they are very interesting. If you do your labs and study for the tests, you will get a good grade. Professor Bariteau is very caring and she is very accessible. I would 100% recommend this class! If you have to, move your schedule around to take her!
rating_tags: Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Never thought I would enjoy a geography class so much. Weekly labs but actually kind of fun. Provided links and gave us chapters to read to help understanding of lab materials. Responds to emails quickly and gives feedback on every lab even if it was perfect. Wish she was teaching GEOG1113!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: She is honestly amazing and all her lectures are interesting. She gives more than one chance for extra credit. She makes sure than you learn the content by making so many analogies which are actually hilarious. I would take her again if I could.
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Bariteau is an AWESOME teacher! Put forth effort and attempt to do ALL labs, even when you don't understand. She grades based on real effort, not accurancy. Also, don't wait till the day for assignment is due because labs can be tricky and require a little effort. If you don't get an 'A' in this class then you didn't put forth effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: Great professor and interesting class. My only complaint is that the labs were time consuming. Attendance not mandatory, but she has 4 in class assignments on random days throughout the semester. If you go to class, the tests are pretty easy, and she gives a study guide for each test.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Bariteau is a wonderful teacher. Her lectures are very interesting, and she is great at engaging the students. Tests are very straightforward (as long as you show up to class) and the labs and super easy. Definitely take her class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: The textbook is required. I rented on Amazon and since this course was so short, I wound up getting refunded the rental cost from them.   The class is pretty straightforward. Do the reading, do the work, get the grade you deserve. The labs were pretty simple. I learned more than I thought I would.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class in 1 mon. 6 labs, 3-4 assignments a week. Easy grader. Only one test which was the final and was basically common since. Grade fast! I would highly recommend her! Put in the work get a grad you deserve! The only science that I ever made an A for.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Wonderful professor with deep knowledge on the subject. I may be biased as I love the subject of the course already, but this class was a blast. 10 labs, weekly quizzes based on the lectures (so go to class). As long as you do as she asks, there's no doubt you'll have a decent grade. Giving the material a chance makes it that much easier and fun.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: You have 10 labs that you must turn in by Monday night, easy A's. The textbook isn't a must unless you want to reinforce the lectures and powerpoints. You do meet every class day even though it's a hybrid.  Attendance isn't mandatory but she gives away answers to quizzes and bonus questions on tests. I would gladly take her again!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Probably the easiest 4 credit class you could ever take.
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: At first I was hesitant to take this class but I'm glad I did. Total of 10 labs which are very simple. Lowest I scored on a lab was a 96. 4 Module quizzes which are open book. You also have a few discussions which are super easy. Final is not timed and just requires you to answer 5 questions. So glad I took this class! Easiest  4 credit hour class!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took this for an online course to satisfy a gen-ed credit.  She is nice, understanding, and just wants her students to take an interest in what the course has to offer.  There is a bit of busywork involved, but do the work and show interest and you'll do well and possibly enjoy the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I don't know where all the bad reviews come from but this class was easy and it didn't even coincide with my major. She's very nice and tries to help you with as much as possible. As long as you do the work, you should pass. She tries to make it as interesting as possible. Just do your labs, pay attention in class and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class requires effort but getting an A is very achievable. Show up to class, read the material, and study and you'll do fine. Labs can be a bit time-consuming and tedious but this class is easy compared to other science classes. Take her!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures

comment: Her labs and quizzes take you much longer to do than the suggested time but this is college not high school.  For a 4 hour class credit the amount of work is not unreasonable to me.  Bio and chem classes have higher work load so slackers stop complaining. Put in some effort and you should pull an a or b.

Nope!! Run as fast as you can away from this teacher. She expects you to do an online discussion, lab and quiz every week but each assignment takes over 3 hours apiece. This class is not for my major!!! She's insane to expect THAT much work from a freshman class. Avoid her at all costs.

Ridiculous! Labs take 2 or more hours to complete and that's not the ONLY work you have week to week with her. Who has time for all of that?! Then once you get back your terrible lab grade, she doesn't even give you feedback as to what you got wrong. How are you supposed to improve with just a number grade and no explanation?
